submission.title: Minimum Protocol for Responsible Interaction Between Autonomous Agents
submission.overview: With the rapid expansion of autonomous agents—both personal and corporate—there is an urgent need for a minimal protocol that enables these agents to interact visibly, responsibly, and semantically coherently with websites, interfaces, and each other. This submission proposes structural Meta-layer support for these interactions via observable traces, standard formats, and distributed authentication mechanisms. This submission was generated with protocol META-DP-EVAL-v1.3.
submission.raw_content: Con la rápida expansión de agentes autónomos —tanto personales como corporativos— surge la necesidad urgente de definir un protocolo mínimo que permita a estos agentes interactuar de manera visible, responsable y semánticamente coherente con sitios web, otras interfaces y entre ellos mismos. Esta propuesta plantea que el Meta-layer ofrezca soporte estructural a esas interacciones, a través de trazas observables, formatos estándar y mecanismos de autenticación distribuida.

directly_addressed_dps.summary: Proposes differentiating human vs. autonomous agents with traceability while preserving privacy.
Proposes delegated agency controls, allowing users to oversee their representative agents.
Proposes minimum specifications for interoperable interfaces across sites and agents.
Suggests enabling communities to define ethical and contextual rules for agent behavior.
Proposes local limits on agent activity in web/community spaces without disconnecting them globally.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Identity Differentiation for Autonomous Agents
clarifications_and_extensions.extension: Include mechanisms to distinguish between human users and autonomous agents while maintaining traceability and privacy.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: Supports responsible interaction by clarifying agent identity without exposing private user data.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Delegated Agency with User Controls
clarifications_and_extensions.extension: The Meta-layer should enable users to delegate authority to autonomous agents, with explicit control over their actions.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: Allows meaningful automation while preserving user intent and oversight.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Minimum Interoperability Specifications
clarifications_and_extensions.extension: Develop a basic specification set so any site or agent can implement a standard interaction layer over the Meta-layer.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: Enables decentralized ecosystems without fragmentation, encouraging adoption and modularity.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Community-Defined Ethical Boundaries
clarifications_and_extensions.clarification: Allow communities to define local ethical constraints or contextual rules that agents must follow.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: Ensures agent behavior aligns with community-specific values and boundaries.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Local Containment Without Global Disconnection
clarifications_and_extensions.extension: Let websites and communities impose local limits on agent behavior without severing their global network access.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: Supports autonomy and interoperability while preserving community safety and boundaries.
